page.title: 09MR. NELSON - A FARM WORKER.
page.content: We had a talk from Mr. Nelson an old farm worker . He told us that in the olden days farm workers were hired the hirings and they had to live and work on the farm for a year. The farmers argreed on a price for the man's labour and then they worked. If they did not like it they wouldn't work for them again.Helperby feast they did all sorts of things games, eating, running sports, and hiring. The farmers went to the feast for labourers and agreed a price with the workers but the labourers stayed at home.There were three horses used for ploughing potoes and only two for corn and one for turnning over. They used three for potatoes because they needed to plough deeper. Mr.Nelson had a farm accident when he chopped his foot off in a rotavator. By Darran Furnass
